text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today 
I'm making yet another simple and easy stir-fry

that you can whip up for a weeknight dinner it's 
something called goong pad nam prik pao now it's

a bit of a mouthful but goong is shrimp Pad means 
to stir-fry and nam prik Pao is Thai chili paste

so it's a quick stir-fry of shrimp that uses 
Thai chili paste as the main flavor so let's

get started whenever I do a stir-fry I always like 
to mix the sauce all together so I have it ready

to go when I'm cooking so of course Thai chili 
paste which is our main flavor for this sauce

Thai chili paste there are many many different 
brands I'm using this brand which I like if

you're not using this brand you have to taste and 
adjust the sauce a little bit because each brand

varies quite significantly now oyster sauce and it 
helps to grease the bowl that you're putting the

oyster sauce in now some soy sauce to sharpen 
up the flavor of the sauce little I like to

add some fish sauce and fish sauce and shrimp go 
together really really well now I know it's a lot

of different sauces but each sauce has different 
flavors so it contributes something different to

the dish and that's why it's worth a little extra 
ingredient gathering time so I'm going to thin

this out a little bit with some water if you've 
got some chicken stock or pork stock on hand you

can do that as well just a couple of tablespoons 
and then I'll keep the rest of the water on hand

for when I'm stir frying all right that's the 
sauce let's talk protein I am using shrimp today

but really you can use whatever kind of protein 
you want in Thailand clams are actually the most

popular type of protein for this dish but I find 
shrimp a little easier to deal with on you know

for a weeknight dinner so that's what I'm doing 
I like to use medium sized shrimp so these are I

think 21 25 shrimp so that means there's 21 to 25 
shrimp to a pound vegetables I'm using asparagus

today just because I like the freshness and the 
crunchiness that they give but when you work with

asparagus remember you want to snap the end off 
and just let it break wherever it wants to break

and that part is generally the woody part that 
you don't want and a slight angle always makes

things a little bit prettier I'm also going to 
add some onion because I like sort of that crunchy

sweetness that comes along with the onion and to 
add a little bit of color I've got some julienned

red pepper now normally I use spur Chili's 
but I didn't have any today but I found these

interesting looking peppers at the store really 
whatever you have at the store that's nice and red

you can you to cherry tomatoes if you wanted to 
and apart from that I've also got some Thai basil

and we are ready to go it's just a little bit 
of oil and I'm going to start with some chopped

garlic and some Thai chilies now the Thai chilies 
are optional if you don't want to make this spicy

you don't have to use it let that infuse into 
the oil and brown just a little bit your heat

does not have to be high for this one case it's 
medium medium-high is perfectly fine now all my

shrimp are going to go it's a quick toss and now 
we're gonna go in with the sauce and right away

the vegetables and I'm going to just add an extra 
splash of water cuz I know it is it is going to be

a little dry just going to cook it and because 
shrimp cooks so fast it should cook just as our

asparagus is done if you like your onions really 
soft and sweet you could definitely add the onions

with the garlic at the beginning also I'm going 
to add a little bit of sugar depending on the

brand of your chilli paste you may not need any 
sugar at all some chili pastes are sweeter than

this one so make sure you taste it and add sugar 
at the end although it's done I'm going to throw

in my peppers and if you find it too dry just 
keep adding a little splash of water at a time

my shrimp are done the asparagus is still nice and 
vibrant and crunchy I'm going to turn off the heat

finish it off with some basil oh ooh spicy and the 
residual heat of the stir-fry will will - basil

that's it easy as that I know garnish with the 
little tops of Thai basil always a nice touch

there you go go patent on pig pound now ideally 
you would have some hot jasmine rice to go with

this but I forgot to make it so we're going to 
go solo mm-hmm the asparagus is still crunchy

there's something about the combination of shrimp 
and asparagus just works so well a little sweet a

little spicy and slight smokiness from the chili 
paste oh it's just simple goodness the recipe as

always is on hot item comm if you get a chance 
to make this send me a photo Facebook Twitter

or Instagram and I will see you next time for your 
next delicious Thai meal in Thailand it's actually

very very popular with clamps I don't mean clams 
like to eat this dish I mean it's made with clams
